chargeHist.descr: Arson of Property Other Than Building

result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond H. Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raymond H. Chapman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raymond H. Chapman was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Raymond H. Chapman was found guilty of Negligent Handling of Burning Material, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.10(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  Matter heard with 15CF707.  State is compliant with victim rights notification.
Count 2-  Defendant is sentenced to 1 year in the Kenosha County Jail w/ huber - concurrent to Racine Co case 15CF848.  DNA surcharge ordered.
Count 3-  Defendant is sentenced to 9 months in the Kenosha County Jail w/ huber - concurrent to count 2.
DE stipulates to restitution.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $500.00 be paid during the term of probation in 15CF707.  Appeal rights given.  DE requests expungement.  Court denies request.
For Restitution order - filed by ADA J Zapf.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  4:05pm-  Matter heard with 15CF706 & 15CF707.  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 2 & 3; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, count 1 is dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bond continued.
Atty:  H Edwards.
Filed by Atty H Edwards.
for Substitution of Counsel

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Attys Theodore Kmiec and Hilary Edwards.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Kmiec allowed to withdraw as counsel.  FPT 9/30/15 at 2:30 with 15-CF-706/707.  Bond continued.

131 p.m.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clk  NJurgens.  Referred to intake for further dispo on 8/14/15 @ 10 a.m. Bond - continued.  Atty Kmiec's motion to withdraw to be heard by Judge S.M Wilk.

Attorney Edwards states she will be taking this case & requests 8/3/2015 motion hearing be rescheduled as she is out sick.  DE has 2 new cases, 15CF706 & 15CF707, with an adjourned initial appearance scheduled before the Intake Court Comissioner on 8/4/2015.  This case will be heard on 8/4/2015 at 1pm with DE's other cases for scheduling purposes only.

1:10 pm    Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk:  NJ.  Referred to Br. 8 for further disposition on 8-3-15 @ 1:30 pm .  Warrant vacated.  $5000 signature bond re-instated as previously set.

MINUTES:  12:08pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Kmiec does not have an explanation for why the DE is not present.  Based on the DE's non-appearance, Court issues a $5,000.00 cash bench warrant & orders $5,000.00 signature bond forfeited - stayed until 6/26/2015 at 12pm.

Defendant, Raymond H. Chapman, appeared with Attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec Iii.  Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.   Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time for discovery and a Joint Services request. Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
